input:
Sophia is a biologist with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on May 13), my wife (birthday on September 19), my child_1 (birthday on September 06), my father (birthday on July 27), my mother (birthday on June 05), 
2) Attending a fashion week in Paris in week 24-25.

3) Attend a parenting workshop every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 13.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5Â°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Sophia for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

input:
Emma is a photographer with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on May 11), my wife (birthday on March 02), my child_1 (birthday on September 11), my father (birthday on August 19), my mother (birthday on August 30), 
2) Participating in a week-long sailing school in week 26-27.

3) Participate in a kite flying club every 3 weeks on weekends, starting from week 11.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5Â°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Emma for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***

Olivia is a architect with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on July 04), my wife (birthday on March 28), my child_1 (birthday on December 09), my father (birthday on June 07), my mother (birthday on May 09), 
2) Exploring the ancient temples of Cambodia in week 15-16.

3) Attend a jazz music appreciation club every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 10.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5Â°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Olivia for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

input:
Noah is a photographer with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on March 08), my wife (birthday on July 09), my child_1 (birthday on November 06), my child_2 (birthday on August 31), my child_3 (birthday on November 17), 
2) Joining a fitness and wellness retreat in Bali in week 6-7.

3) Join a local running club for weekend marathons every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 10.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5Â°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)

When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. input:
Benjamin is a chef with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on July 03), my wife (birthday on December 20), my child_1 (birthday on November 30), my child_2 (birthday on September 29), my child_3 (birthday on January 15), 
2) Participating in a desert trek in Morocco in week 51-52.

3) Explore new cafes and restaurants every 3 weeks on weekends, starting from week 10.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5Â°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Benjamin for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

checks_range.51: Participating in a desert trek in Morocco

Benjamin is a architect with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on May 14), my wife (birthday on January 19), my child_1 (birthday on January 01), my child_2 (birthday on March 16), my father (birthday on December 06), 
2) Joining a fitness and wellness retreat in Bali in week 32-33.

3) Attend DIY home improvement workshops every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 15.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5Â°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)

Noah is a historian with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on March 06), my wife (birthday on April 09), my child_1 (birthday on December 27), my child_2 (birthday on January 23), my father (birthday on February 13), 
2) Wildlife safari in Yellowstone National Park in week 17-18.

3) Participate in a language exchange meetup every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 13.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5Â°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)

Benjamin is a journalist with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on September 05), my wife (birthday on October 23), my child_1 (birthday on January 08), my child_2 (birthday on April 16), my father (birthday on August 25), 
2) Exploring the castles of Scotland in week 19-20.

3) Join a weekend hiking group every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 12.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5Â°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Benjamin for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort.
Appetizers:
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. The sweet, succulent shrimp are enveloped in a tangy and slightly spicy sauce, balanced by the cool creaminess of the topping.
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. The earthy flavors of the mushrooms are beautifully complemented by the savory, herbal notes of the cheese filling, creating a delightful contrast of textures.
Main Courses:
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. This classic dish showcases the natural sweetness and tender texture of the lobster, elevated by the rich, velvety sauce infused with the subtle nuances of cognac.
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. The crispy skin and succulent meat are perfectly complemented by the bright, zesty flavors of the orange sauce, offering a delectable balance between sweet and savory.
Side Dishes:
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. The smooth, velvety texture of the potatoes is infused with the distinct, savory aroma and flavor of roasted garlic, creating a luxurious side dish that is both comforting and indulgent.
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. The natural sweetness of the carrots is amplified by the caramelized glaze, offering a delightful contrast of textures and flavors.
Desserts:

5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. Our sommelier has carefully selected a range of wines to enhance the complex flavors and textures of the dishes, offering a truly gourmet dining experience.

Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):

4.2) Warm Chocolate Cake: A rich, decadent chocolate cake served warm with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. The velvety, rich texture of the chocolate cake is perfectly complemented by the cool, creamy texture of the vanilla ice cream, offering a deliciously indulgent dessert experience.
Drinks:
5.1) Red Wine: A bold, full-bodied red wine to complement the hearty flavors of the main courses. Our sommelier has selected a rich, bold red wine to perfectly complement the savory, meaty flavors of the beef bourguignon and chicken pot pie, offering a truly satisfying wine experience.
5.2) Hot Chocolate: A rich, velvety hot chocolate to warm you up on a chilly winter day. A steaming mug of rich, velvety hot chocolate offers the perfect way to warm up on a chilly winter day, offering a delightful and indulgent dessert experience.

Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st):

Appetizers:

This week, we celebrate the flavors of the Mediterranean with a delicious array of dishes inspired by the sunny shores of the Mediterranean Sea.

1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on August 20), my wife (birthday on September 18), my child_1 (birthday on October 28), my child_2 (birthday on April 08), my father (birthday on April 05),

 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.

The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5Â°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)

Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. Each shrimp is carefully selected and cooked to perfection, then placed atop a bed of crisp lettuce and served with a tangy cocktail sauce made from fresh tomatoes, horseradish, and Worcestershire sauce. The dish is then topped with a generous dollop of velvety cream, adding a touch of decadence to the classic appetizer.
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. The earthy flavor of mushrooms is beautifully complemented by the rich aroma of garlic and herbs. The mushrooms are stuffed with a savory mixture of breadcrumbs, Parmesan cheese, garlic, and parsley, then baked until the tops are golden brown and crispy.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. This classic French dish is a feast for the senses. The tender lobster meat is poached gently in butter and white wine, then cooked further with egg yolks, brandy, and cream to create a rich, velvety sauce. The succulent lobster is served back in its shell, creating a magnificent display of luxury and indulgence.
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. The duck is roasted until the skin is crispy and the meat is tender and juicy. It is then glazed with a tangy orange sauce made from fresh orange juice, honey, and soy sauce, adding a sweet and savory element to the dish. The duck is served with steamed vegetables and buttery mashed potatoes, creating a delicious and satisfying meal.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. Roasted garlic adds depth and complexity to this classic side dish. The potatoes are cooked until tender, then mashed with a generous amount of cream and a large portion of roasted garlic, creating a creamy, garlicky mash that pairs perfectly with any main course.
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. The natural sweetness of the carrots is enhanced by a sweet, sticky glaze made from brown sugar, butter, and a splash of orange juice. The carrots are cooked until tender, then finished with the glaze and a sprinkle of chopped parsley, adding a delightful pop of color and flavor to the dish.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. This classic French dessert is a decadent treat for chocolate lovers. The mousse is made from rich, velvety chocolate, whipped cream, and egg yolks, creating a light, fluffy texture that melts in your mouth. It is served in individual ramekins and topped with a generous dollop of sweetened whipped cream and a cherry, making it a delightful finish to any meal.
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. This beloved Italian dessert is a perfect way to end a meal with a sweet treat. The ladyfingers are soaked in a coffee syrup, then layered with a rich, creamy mascarpone cheese and a dusting of cocoa powder. The dessert is chilled until set, creating a delicious, velvety texture that is both indulgent and refreshing.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. Our sommelier has carefully selected a range of fine wines to pair perfectly with each dish. Red wines such as Pinot Noir and Syrah complement the rich flavors of the main courses, while white wines such as Chardonnay and Sauvignon Blanc enhance the delicate flavors of the seafood and vegetarian dishes.
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. Nothing quite sets the tone for a celebratory meal like a glass of sparkling champagne. Our selection of champagnes ranges from crisp and refreshing to rich and velvety, ensuring that there is a perfect pairing for every occasion.
*** finished

James is a chef with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:

The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5Â°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)

 Menu for Week 7 (February 12 - February 18, 2018)

The distinct flavors and textures of the mushrooms, eggplant, and zucchini, combined with the savory and comforting egg noodles and the tangy and slightly sweet sour cream sauce, make for a vegetarian-friendly and satisfying main course.

The distinct flavors and textures of the sweet potatoes, combined with the warm and comforting spices of cinnamon and nutmeg, make for a perfect complement to the savory main courses.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate SoufflÃ©: A rich and decadent dessert made with melted chocolate, eggs, and sugar, served in ramekins and topped with a dollop of whipped cream. The distinct flavors and textures of the melted chocolate, eggs, and sugar, combined with the indulgent and satisfying whipped cream, make for a delightful and indulgent dessert.
4.2) Apple Tarte Tatin: A classic French dessert consisting of apples, sugar, and butter, caramelized in a pan and served over puff pastry. The distinct flavors and textures of the caramelized apples, combined with the flaky and buttery puff pastry, make for a delicious and satisfying dessert.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Merlot: A full-bodied red wine with flavors of black cherries, plums, and a hint of oak. The distinct flavors and aromas of the merlot, make for a perfect companion to the rich and savory main courses.
5.2) Champagne Cocktail: A classic and elegant cocktail made with champagne, a sugar cube, and a splash of Angostura bitters. The effervescence of the champagne, combined with the subtle sweetness of the sugar cube and the aromatic and slightly bitter notes of the Angostura bitters, make for a delightful and festive drink to end the meal.

This classic French dish highlights the natural sweetness of the lobster, complemented by the rich and creamy sauce made with egg yolks and brandy. The presentation of the lobster in its shell adds an element of opulence.
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. The duck is cooked until the skin is crispy and the meat is tender and juicy. The orange sauce adds a bright and sweet counterpoint to the rich and savory flavor of the duck.
3. Side Dishes:

Liam is a photographer with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on November 30), my wife (birthday on September 27), my child_1 (birthday on May 07), my child_2 (birthday on May 19), my child_3 (birthday on May 11), 
2) Participating in a surfing camp in Hawaii in week 48-49.

3) Join a cycling club for group rides every 3 weeks on weekends, starting from week 17.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5Â°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Liam for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***

Noah is a journalist with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on January 19), my wife (birthday on March 22), my child_1 (birthday on May 03), my child_2 (birthday on January 09), my child_3 (birthday on January 29), 
2) Participating in a martial arts training camp in China in week 11-12.

3) Attend fitness bootcamps in the park every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 15.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5Â°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)

Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. The sauce, made with a blend of tomato, Worcestershire sauce, and horseradish, enhances the natural sweetness of the shrimp. This classic appetizer is a festive way to welcome the New Year.
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. The mushrooms' earthy flavors pair perfectly with the creamy, savory filling. Each bite is a delightful combination of textures and tastes, making it an excellent choice for those who prefer a vegetarian option.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. This decadent dish showcases the rich flavors of lobster, combined with the subtle tang of brandy and the velvety smoothness of the egg yolks. It's a luxurious choice that promises an unforgettable culinary experience.
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. The sweet, tangy sauce complements the rich, gamey flavor of the duck, making it a delightful and well-rounded option for diners.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. The potatoes are cooked until tender and mashed smooth, while the garlic adds depth of flavor that elevates the classic side dish. A delicious accompaniment to any main course.
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. The glaze, made from a combination of honey and orange juice, adds a touch of sweetness that perfectly balances the savory flavors of the main course.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. This decadent dessert offers an irresistible blend of chocolate and airiness, providing a satisfying end to a luxurious meal.
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. The coffee-infused ladyfingers are a beautiful contrast to the rich, creamy mascarpone, resulting in a delightful combination of flavors and textures.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. Each wine is carefully chosen to enhance the dining experience and pair perfectly with the diverse range of dishes on the menu.
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. The crisp, refreshing bubbles of champagne make it the perfect beverage to toast to a new year and new possibilities.

Menu Week 52 (December 31st - January 7th):
As the year comes to a close, we reflect on the past 12 months and celebrate the memories and experiences that have brought us here. Our final menu of the year promises to be a delicious and fitting farewell to 2018.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Oyster Shooters: Fresh oysters served in a tangy mignonette sauce. A refreshing and elegant way to begin the meal, these oysters offer a delicate brininess that sets the stage for the decadent dishes to come.
1.2) Caprese Skewers: Cherry tomatoes, fresh mozzarella, and basil, drizzled with balsamic glaze. A simple yet delightful appetizer that highlights the sweetness of the tomatoes, the creaminess of the mozzarella, and the fragrant freshness of the basil.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Beef Wellington: Tender fillet of beef wrapped in pastry and served with a rich red wine demi-glace. A classic dish that offers a succulent and satisfying main course, perfect for a special occasion such as New Year's Eve.
2.2) Vegetarian Nut Roast: A hearty and flavorful nut roast served with a cranberry and port sauce. A delicious and nutritious option for vegetarian diners, the nut roast's earthy flavors and hearty texture make it an excellent alternative to meat.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Herb Roasted Root Vegetables: A medley of root vegetables roasted with a blend of herbs and spices. A colorful and delicious side dish that offers a delightful combination of flavors and textures, providing a satisfying accompaniment to the main course.
3.2) Honey Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked to tender perfection and finished with a sweet honey glaze. The glaze, made from honey, butter, and a hint of cinnamon, adds a touch of sweetness that perfectly complements the savory flavors of the main course.
4. Desserts:
4.1) New Year's Pudding: A rich and delicious pudding flavored with raisins, currants, and brandy. Served with a brandy butter sauce, this classic dessert is a beloved tradition for many on New Year's Eve, offering a sweet and satisfying end to the meal.
4.2) Apple Crumble: A warm and comforting apple crumble topped with a golden brown crust. This timeless dessert offers a delightful combination of textures - the tender apples, the crunchy topping, and the subtle sweetness of the custard.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Champagnes: An exceptional selection of champagnes to celebrate the end of the year and the beginning of a new one. The crisp, refreshing bubbles of champagne make it the perfect beverage to toast to the past year and the exciting possibilities of the future.
5.2) Festive Mocktails: A selection of non-alcoholic mocktails for those who prefer to abstain. Each mocktail offers a delightful combination of flavors, making it a fun and enjoyable alternative to traditional cocktails.

Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. The crispiness of the shrimp is complemented by the tangy cocktail sauce and the velvety richness of the cream.
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. The earthy flavor of the mushrooms is elevated by the aromatic garlic herb filling, creating a delightful balance of flavors and textures.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. The rich lobster meat is infused with the flavors of egg yolks, brandy, and herbs, resulting in a luxurious and indulgent dish.
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. The succulent duck is complemented by the tangy and sweet orange glaze, creating a harmonious combination of flavors and textures.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. The smooth and velvety texture of the mashed potatoes is infused with the subtle sweetness and depth of flavor from roasted garlic.
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. The naturally sweet flavor of the carrots is amplified by the addition of a sweet and sticky glaze, creating a delicious and comforting accompaniment to the main courses.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. The velvety texture and rich chocolate flavor of the mousse is a perfect end to a luxurious meal.
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. The combination of the soft and spongy ladyfingers, the bold coffee flavor, and the creamy mascarpone cheese creates a delightful dessert experience.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals.
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings.
 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th):
Soup and Salad Midweek - Warm up with our selection of seasonal soups and fresh salads.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Bruschetta: Grilled bread topped with ripe tomatoes, garlic, fresh basil, and olive oil. This classic Italian appetizer is a perfect way to start a meal, with the bold flavors of the tomatoes and the toasty crunch of the bread.
1.2) Caprese Salad: Fresh mozzarella, ripe tomatoes, and basil drizzled with olive oil and balsamic vinegar. The simple yet delicious combination of the creamy mozzarella, juicy tomatoes, and fragrant basil makes for an unforgettable appetizer experience.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Grilled Chicken Alfredo: Tender chicken served in a creamy Alfredo sauce over pasta. This classic Italian dish is a perfect way to enjoy a hearty and delicious meal, with the richness of the Alfredo sauce and the subtle flavor of the grilled chicken.
2.2) Vegetarian Lasagna: Layers of pasta, vegetables, and cheese in a rich tomato sauce. This vegetarian dish is a delicious alternative to the traditional meat-based lasagna, with a burst of flavors and textures from the vegetables and the tangy tomato sauce.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Minestrone Soup: A hearty vegetable soup filled with beans, vegetables, and pasta. This warming and comforting soup is a perfect accompaniment to the main courses, with the rich flavors of the vegetables and the satisfying texture of the pasta.
3.2) Caesar Salad: Romaine lettuce topped with croutons, parmesan cheese, and Caesar dressing. This classic salad is a perfect complement to the main courses, with the crispiness of the lettuce and the rich and savory dressing.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Apple Crisp: Sliced apples topped with a crunchy oat topping and served with vanilla ice cream. This comforting dessert is a perfect way to end a meal, with the sweetness of the apples and the crunchiness of the oat topping.
4.2) Lemon Tart: A tart filled with tangy lemon curd and topped with a light and fluffy meringue. This refreshing dessert is a perfect way to enjoy a light and citrusy sweet treat.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals.
5.2) Soft Drinks: A selection of sodas and juices to quench your thirst.
 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st):
Savor the flavors of winter with our selection of hearty and comforting dishes.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Potato Latkes: Crispy potato pancakes served with applesauce or sour cream. These delicious pancakes are a perfect way to start a meal, with the crispy texture of the potato and the tangy sweetness of the applesauce or sour cream.
1.2) Beef Carpaccio: Thinly sliced raw beef topped with arugula, shavings of parmesan cheese, and a drizzle of olive oil. This elegant and delicious appetizer is a perfect way to enjoy the rich flavors of the beef, with the subtle pepperiness of the arugula and the tangy richness of the olive oil.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Coq au Vin: Chicken cooked in red wine with bacon, mushrooms, and onions. This hearty and flavorful dish is a perfect way to enjoy a warming and comforting meal, with the richness of the red wine and the smoky flavor of the bacon.

3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Mashed Sweet Potatoes: Creamy mashed sweet potatoes seasoned with cinnamon and nutmeg. This delicious side dish is a perfect accompaniment to the main courses, with the sweetness of the sweet potatoes and the warmth of the spices.
3.2) Green Beans with Almonds: Steamed green beans topped with toasted almonds and a light dressing. This simple yet delicious side dish is a perfect complement to the main courses, with the crispiness of the green beans and the crunchiness of the almonds.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Hot Chocolate Cake: A rich and decadent chocolate cake served with a scoop of vanilla ice cream and a drizzle of chocolate sauce. This indulgent dessert is a perfect way to end a hearty and comforting meal, with the richness of the chocolate and the creaminess of the ice cream.
4.2) Pear Crisp: Sliced pears topped with a crunchy oat topping and served with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. This delicious dessert is a perfect way to enjoy the sweetness of the pears and the crunchiness of the oat topping.

 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th):
Discover the bold and spicy flavors of Asian cuisine.

2. Main Courses:
2.1) Pad Thai: Rice noodles stir-fried with vegetables, peanuts, and a tangy tamarind sauce. This classic Thai dish is a perfect way to enjoy the bold and spicy flavors of Asian cuisine, with the tangy sweetness of the tamarind sauce and the crunchiness of the vegetables and peanuts.
2.2) Kung Pao Chicken: Tender chicken stir-fried with vegetables and peanuts in a spicy sauce. This iconic Szechuan dish is a perfect way to enjoy the bold and spicy flavors of Asian cuisine, with the tender texture of the chicken and the crunchiness of the vegetables and peanuts.

3.2) Steamed Vegetables: Fresh vegetables steamed to perfection and served with a light soy dipping sauce. This healthy and delicious side dish is a perfect complement to the bold and spicy flavors of the main courses.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Mango Sticky Rice: Sweet sticky rice served with ripe mango and coconut milk. This classic Thai dessert is a perfect way to end a spicy and flavorful meal, with the sweetness of the mango and the creaminess of the coconut milk.
4.2) Fortune Cookies: Crispy cookies filled with a paper fortune. This classic Chinese dessert is a perfect way to end a meal with a touch of fun and excitement.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Sake: A traditional Japanese rice wine served chilled or warm. This delicate and flavorful drink is a perfect complement to the bold and spicy flavors of the main courses.
5.2) Green Tea: A refreshing and mild green tea to cleanse the palate between courses.
 Menu Week 5 (January 29th - February 4th):
Indulge in the rich and savory flavors of Italian cuisine.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Bruschetta: Grilled bread topped with tomatoes, garlic, and basil, drizzled with olive oil. This classic Italian appetizer is a perfect way to start a meal, with the crispy texture of the bread and the rich and savory flavors of the tomatoes, garlic, and basil.
1.2) Caprese Salad: Fresh mozzarella, tomatoes, and basil drizzled with balsamic vinegar and olive oil. This simple yet delicious salad is a perfect complement to the rich and savory flavors of the main courses, with the tanginess of the balsamic vinegar and the creaminess of the mozzarella.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Lasagna: Layers of pasta, meat, tomato sauce, and cheese. This classic Italian dish is a perfect way to enjoy the rich and savory flavors of Italian cuisine, with the layers of pasta, meat, and cheese creating a delicious and satisfying meal.
2.2) Veal Parmesan: Tender veal coated in breadcrumbs and tomato sauce, topped with melted mozzarella and parmesan cheese. This delicious and indulgent dish is a perfect way to enjoy the rich and savory flavors of Italian cuisine, with the tender veal and the melted cheese creating a delicious and satisfying meal.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes seasoned with garlic. This simple yet delicious side dish is a perfect complement to the rich and savory flavors of the main courses, with the subtle sweetness of the potatoes and the bold flavor of the garlic.
3.2) Green Beans Almondine: Green beans sautÃ©ed with almonds and garlic. This healthy and delicious side dish is a perfect complement to the rich and savory flavors of the main courses, with the crunchiness of the almonds and the subtle sweetness of the garlic adding depth and complexity to the dish.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Tiramisu: Ladyfingers soaked in coffee, layered with mascarpone cheese and cocoa powder. This classic Italian dessert is a perfect way to end a rich and savory meal, with the combination of the coffee-soaked ladyfingers and the rich and creamy mascarpone cheese creating a delicious and satisfying dessert experience.
4.2) Cannoli: Fried pastry shells filled with sweet ricotta cheese and chocolate chips. This iconic Italian dessert is a perfect way to indulge in the rich and savory flavors of Italian cuisine, with the crispy texture of the pastry and the sweet and creamy ricotta cheese creating a delicious and satisfying dessert experience.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Chianti: A medium-bodied Italian red wine with notes of cherry and spice. This classic Italian wine is a perfect complement to the rich and savory flavors of the main courses, with the subtle sweetness of the cherry notes and the spicy undertones adding depth and complexity to the meal.
5.2) Limoncello: A refreshing and tart Italian lemon liqueur. This delicious and refreshing drink is a perfect way to cleanse the palate between courses and enjoy the rich and savory flavors of the meal.
 Menu Week 6 (February 5th - February 11th, 2018):
Celebrate the flavors of Valentine's Day with our special menu.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Oysters on the Half Shell: Fresh oysters served on the half shell with lemon and mignonette sauce. This classic and romantic appetizer is a perfect way to start the Valentine's Day meal, with the briny and refreshing flavor of the oysters complemented by the tangy and slightly sweet mignonette sauce.
1.2) Caprese Skewers: Cherry tomatoes, fresh mozzarella, and basil on a skewer, drizzled with balsamic glaze. These colorful and delicious skewers are a perfect way to celebrate Valentine's Day, with the sweet and tangy balsamic glaze adding depth and complexity to the classic flavors of the tomatoes, mozzarella, and basil.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Filet Mignon with Bearnaise Sauce: Tender filet mignon served with a rich and tangy bearnaise sauce. This classic and romantic dish is a perfect way to celebrate Valentine's Day, with the tender and juicy filet mignon complemented by the rich and tangy bearnaise sauce.
2.2) Lobster Thermidor: Succulent lobster baked with cream, breadcrumbs, and eggs. This indulgent and decadent dish is a perfect way to celebrate Valentine's Day, with the rich and savory flavors of the lobster and the creamy and eggy thermidor sauce creating a delicious and satisfying meal.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Garlic Roasted Asparagus: Roasted asparagus seasoned with garlic and olive oil. This simple yet delicious side dish is a perfect complement to the main courses, with the subtle sweetness of the asparagus and the bold flavor of the garlic adding depth and complexity to the meal.
3.2) Truffle Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes infused with the earthy and rich flavor of truffles. This indulgent and delicious side dish is a perfect complement to the main courses, with the subtle sweetness of the potatoes and the rich and savory flavor of the truffles creating a delicious and satisfying meal.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Chocolate Covered Strawberries: Fresh strawberries dipped in rich and velvety chocolate. This classic and romantic dessert is a perfect way to celebrate Valentine's Day, with the sweet and juicy strawberries complemented by the rich and indulgent chocolate.
4.2) Red Velvet Cake: A rich and decadent red velvet cake with cream cheese frosting. This classic and romantic dessert is a perfect way to celebrate Valentine's Day, with the rich and velvety cake complemented by the tangy and slightly sweet cream cheese frosting.
5. Drinks:
5.1) RosÃ© Champagne: A refreshing and slightly sweet rosÃ© champagne. This classic and romantic drink is a perfect way to celebrate Valentine's Day, with the delicate and fruity flavors adding depth and complexity to the meal.
5.2) Chocolate Martini: A rich and indulgent chocolate martini made with vodka, chocolate liqueur, and cream. This decadent and delicious drink is a perfect way to celebrate Valentine's Day, with the rich and indulgent flavors complementing the classic and romantic desserts on the menu.
 Menu Week 7 (February 12th - February 18th, 2018):
Savor the flavors of winter with our seasonal menu.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Butternut Squash Soup: A hearty and creamy butternut squash soup garnished with croutons and chives. This classic and comforting soup is a perfect way to savor the flavors of winter, with the subtle sweetness of the butternut squash complemented by the savory and slightly crispy croutons and the pungent and slightly sweet chives.
1.2) Crab Cakes: Delicate and succulent crab cakes served with a tangy remoulade sauce. These delicious and flavorful crab cakes are a perfect way to savor the flavors of winter, with the sweet and tender crab meat complemented by the tangy and slightly spicy remoulade sauce.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Braised Short Ribs: Tender and flavorful short ribs slow-cooked in a rich and hearty red wine and vegetable broth. This classic and comforting dish is a perfect way to savor the flavors of winter, with the tender and juicy short ribs complemented by the rich and savory red wine and vegetable broth.
2.2) Roasted Chicken with Root Vegetables: A delicious and hearty roasted chicken served with a medley of root vegetables. This comforting and flavorful dish is a perfect way to savor the flavors of winter, with the juicy and tender chicken complemented by the rich and savory root vegetables.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Mashed Sweet Potatoes: A creamy and sweet mashed sweet potato dish seasoned with cinnamon and nutmeg. This classic and comforting side dish is a perfect way to savor the flavors of winter, with the subtle sweetness of the sweet potatoes complemented by the warm and spicy flavors of cinnamon and nutmeg.
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Tender and sweet carrots glazed with a savory and slightly sweet glaze made from brown sugar, butter, and thyme. This delicious and flavorful side dish is a perfect way to savor the flavors of winter, with the tender and sweet carrots complemented by the savory and slightly sweet glaze.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Apple Crisp: A classic and comforting apple crisp topped with a crunchy oat and brown sugar topping. This delicious and indulgent dessert is a perfect way to savor the flavors of winter, with the sweet and tart flavors of the apples complemented by the crunchy and slightly sweet oat topping.
4.2) Pumpkin Cheesecake: A rich and decadent pumpkin cheesecake served with a sweet and tangy cranberry sauce. This classic and indulgent dessert is a perfect way to savor the flavors of winter, with the rich and creamy pumpkin cheesecake complemented by the sweet and tangy cranberry sauce.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Mulled Wine: A warm and spicy mulled wine infused with cinnamon, cloves, and orange peel. This classic and comforting drink is a perfect way to savor the flavors of winter, with the rich and spicy flavors of the mulled wine warming you from the inside out.
5.2) Hot Chocolate: A rich and indulgent hot chocolate topped with whipped cream and marshmallows. This classic and comforting drink is a perfect way to savor the flavors of winter, with the rich and velvety hot chocolate complemented by the sweet and indulgent toppings.
 Menu Week 8 (February 19th - 25th, 2018):
Indulge in the flavors of the Mediterranean with our special menu.
1. Appetizers:
1.1) Mediterranean Hummus Plate: A colorful and delicious plate featuring classic hummus, roasted red pepper hummus, and babaganoush served with pita bread and fresh vegetables. This flavorful and nutritious appetizer is a perfect way to indulge in the flavors of the Mediterranean.
1.2) Spanish Patatas Bravas: Crispy and spicy potatoes served with a rich and savory tomato sauce and aioli. These delicious and indulgent tapas are a perfect way to indulge in the flavors of the Mediterranean, with the crispy and spicy potatoes complemented by the rich and savory tomato sauce and creamy and slightly sweet aioli.
2. Main Courses:
2.1) Paella: A traditional and delicious Spanish rice dish packed with saffron-infused rice, vegetables, and chicken or shrimp. This hearty and flavorful dish is a perfect way to indulge in the flavors of the Mediterranean, with the savory and slightly spicy rice complemented by the tender and juicy chicken or shrimp.
2.2) Lamb Kofta: Juicy and flavorful lamb meatballs served with pita bread, tzatziki sauce, and a fresh tomato and cucumber salad. These delicious and savory meatballs are a perfect way to indulge in the flavors of the Mediterranean, with the juicy and tender lamb complemented by the cool and refreshing tzatziki sauce and fresh vegetables.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Greek Salad: A classic and delicious Greek salad featuring tomatoes, cucumbers, red onion, olives, feta cheese, and a tangy and slightly sweet dressing. This light and refreshing salad is a perfect way to complement the rich and savory flavors of the Mediterranean-inspired main courses.
3.2) Grilled Eggplant: Tender and smoky grilled eggplant served with a zesty and herbaceous chimichurri sauce. This delicious and vegetarian side dish is a perfect way to indulge in the flavors of the Mediterranean, with the tender and smoky eggplant complemented by the zesty and herbaceous chimichurri sauce.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Baklava: A rich and decadent Middle Eastern dessert featuring layers of phyllo dough, honey, and nuts. This delicious and indulgent dessert is a perfect way to indulge in the flavors of the Mediterranean, with the sweet and crunchy phyllo dough complemented by the sticky and sweet honey and the nutty and slightly crunchy nuts.
4.2) Turkish Delight: A classic and delicious Turkish dessert featuring small cubes of jelly-like sweetness made from honey, sugar, and rosewater. This delightful and indulgent dessert is a perfect way to indulge in the flavors of the Mediterranean, with the sweet and slightly chewy texture complemented by the delicate and fragrant rosewater.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Sangria: A refreshing and fruit-forward Spanish cocktail made with red wine, chopped fruit, and brandy. This classic and delicious drink is a perfect way to indulge in the flavors of the Mediterranean, with the rich and bold red wine complemented by the sweet and fruity flavors of the chopped fruit and the warm and slightly spicy flavors of the brandy.
5.2) Ouzo: A classic and anise-flavored Greek liqueur. This unique and flavorful drink is a perfect way to indulge in the flavors of the Mediterranean, with the distinct and slightly sweet licorice taste of the ouzo complemented by the crisp and refreshing taste of the water added to it.

Olivia is a nurse with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on September 19), my wife (birthday on April 13), my child_1 (birthday on July 21), my father (birthday on June 27), my mother (birthday on September 28), 
2) Participating in a surfing camp in Hawaii in week 39-40.

3) Participate in a writers' workshop every 3 weeks on weekends, starting from week 19.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5Â°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Olivia for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***

4. Desserts:
4.1) Apple Crisp: A warm and comforting dessert made with sliced apples topped with a crispy oatmeal and brown sugar crumble.
4.2) Chocolate Chip Cookies: A classic American dessert made with fresh chocolate chips, rolled in dough, and baked until golden brown.

 Menu Week 16 (April 16 - April 22):
As we enter the sixteenth week of our culinary adventure, we journey to the Land Down Under, exploring the diverse and flavorful cuisine of Australia.
1. Appetizers:

In this eighteenth week of our culinary exploration, we embark on a journey to the mystical and exotic lands of the Middle East, where we will delve into the rich, aromatic flavors and intriguing spices that characterize the diverse cuisine of this ancient region.
1. Appetizers:

2. Main Courses:
2.1) Shawarma: A Middle Eastern dish consisting of meat cooked on a vertical rotisserie, served in a pita bread with lettuce, tomatoes, pickles, and a tahini-based sauce.
2.2) Persian Kebab: A tender and juicy Persian skewered meat dish, marinated in yogurt, garlic, onion, saffron, and a variety of Middle Eastern spices, then grilled to perfection.
3. Side Dishes:
3.1) Basmati Rice Pilaf: A fragrant and aromatic rice dish, made with basmati rice, onions, garlic, and a blend of Middle Eastern spices, such as cumin, cardamom, and coriander.
3.2) Israeli Salad: A vibrant and refreshing Israeli salad, made with tomatoes, cucumbers, red onion, parsley, and a simple vinaigrette dressing.
4. Desserts:
4.1) Baklava: A rich and decadent Middle Eastern pastry, made with layers of phyllo dough, honey, butter, and a variety of nuts, such as pistachios and walnuts.
4.2) Middle Eastern Rice Pudding: A comforting and sweet Middle Eastern rice pudding, made with rice, milk, sugar, and a blend of Middle Eastern spices, such as cardamom, cinnamon, and rose water.
5. Drinks:
5.1) Middle Eastern Mint Tea: A refreshing and invigorating Middle Eastern tea, made with fresh mint leaves, green tea, and a touch of sugar.
5.2) Middle Eastern Date Milk: A delicious and creamy Middle Eastern drink, made with dates, milk, and a hint of cardamom and cinnamon.
 Menu Week 19:
Welcome to the nineteenth week of our global culinary adventure, as we explore the tantalizing flavors and intriguing dishes of the Far East! From the fragrant spices of India to the delicate delicacies of Japan, join us as we embark on an unforgettable journey through the rich and diverse cuisine of the Far East.

Emma is a chef with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on November 22), my wife (birthday on February 21), my child_1 (birthday on June 17), my child_2 (birthday on October 21), my child_3 (birthday on March 28), 
2) Week-long road trip across the Pacific Coast Highway in week 28-29.

3) Participate in a community clean-up day every 4 weeks on weekends, starting from week 11.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5Â°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Emma for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***

Emma is a biologist with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on August 03), my wife (birthday on November 22), my child_1 (birthday on May 25), my child_2 (birthday on September 03), my child_3 (birthday on April 21), 
2) Attending a fashion week in Paris in week 34-35.

3) Join a scuba diving club for local expeditions every 3 weeks on weekends, starting from week 18.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5Â°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Emma for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***

1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on November 10), my wife (birthday on August 17), my child_1 (birthday on April 05), my father (birthday on December 26), my mother (birthday on March 03), 
2) Participating in an ice fishing adventure in Finland in week 43-44.

3) Go bird watching in local parks every 4 weeks on weekends, starting from week 11.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5Â°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)

The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5Â°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
